items.title: AC Milan verovert koppositie van aartsrivaal na probleemloze middag
items.summary: AC Milan is voorlopig de koploper in de Serie A. Op een probleemloze middag won de topclub met klinkende cijfer van Hellas Verona dankzij twee treffers van Christopher Nkunku. Aartsrivaal Internazionale komt later in actie en kan de eerste plaats overnemen.

items.title: VI Live: amateurvoetballer trefzeker op Afrika Cup, Nederlands trio bij Sunderland
items.summary: Goedendag en welkom in de VI Live van zondag 28 december! De laatste zondag van 2025 zit vol met leuke wedstrijden, en in dit liveblog hoeft u niks te missen.

items.title: Ajax praat met Burnley over Hartman, speler aan zet
Van Dijk: More to come from Wirtz for Liverpool
items.summary: Virgil van Dijk has heaped praise on teammate Florian Wirtz and backed him to continue delivering for Liverpool after he scored his first goal for the club in Saturday's 2-1 victory over Wolverhampton Wanderers.

items.title: √òdegaard: Rice has put Arsenal in charge again
items.summary: Martin Odegaard believes Declan Rice's "unbelievable" performance as an emergency right-back demonstrates that Arsenal are "ready to do whatever it takes" to win the Premier League.

items.title: James: Only Chelsea to blame for Villa collapse
items.summary: Captain Reece James feels Chelsea have themselves to blame after throwing away a half-time lead to lose 2-1 to Aston Villa.

items.title: Lazio voelt zich benadeeld door arbitrage en brengt nieuw statement naar buiten
items.summary: Lazio heeft een statement naar buiten gebracht, waarin felle kritiek wordt geuit op Serie A-scheidsrechters. De club uit Rome leek zaterdagavond op weg naar een overwinning op Udinese, maar in de laatste minuut van het duel viel alsnog de gelijkmaker. Daar ging volgens Lazio een vermeende handsbal aan vooraf. De club is de Italiaanse arbitrage spuugzat.

items.title: Voormalig FC Utrecht-talent Boussaid hard op weg naar Griekenland
items.summary: Othmane Boussaid (25) kan zijn carri√®re vervolgen in Griekenland. Momenteel is het voormalige talent van FC Utrecht en NAC Breda actief in de Verenigde Arabische Emiraten. Aris Saloniki wil daar echter verandering in brengen, bevestigen ingewijden.

items.title: Watkins brace seals Villa an 11th consecutive win
items.summary: Aston Villa's remarkable winning run continued as Ollie Watkins came off the bench in the second half to score twice and earn a valuable 2-1 victory over Chelsea.

items.title: Root: 'Silly' to change England management after Ashes defeat
items.summary: Joe Root says it would be "silly" for England to change their management team after the Ashes defeat and insists the players are "absolutely committed" to the current set-up.

items.title: Chelsea investigate after bottle thrown at Villa bench
items.summary: Chelsea will look into an incident after a plastic bottle containing what looked like water was thrown at Aston Villa's staff and players.

items.title: World Darts Championship LIVE! Cross and Anderson in action after Searle wins
Ex-England striker Carroll due in court after arrest
items.summary: Former Newcastle United, Liverpool and England forward Andy Carroll is due to appear in court on Tuesday after he was charged with breaching a non-molestation order.

items.title: MCG pitch curator in 'state of shock' after whirlwind two-day Ashes Test
items.summary: Melbourne Cricket Ground pitch curator Matthew Page says he is in a "state of shock" after the Boxing Day Ashes Test at the venue lasted just two days and has vowed to "get it right next year".

items.title: Thomas Frank convinced he can repeat Brentford trick with Tottenham revival
items.summary: Manager made slow starts with previous clubs Frank: ‚ÄòI am convinced we will see a similar pattern here‚Äô Thomas Frank is convinced the story from his previous clubs will repeat itself at Tottenham ‚Äì with unconvincing starts giving way to consistent results and achievement. The manager is conscious that losing can become a habit and he takes his team to Crystal Palace on Sunday in need of a tonic, having suffered six defeats in the past 10 Premier League matches, winning only twice during the sequence. Continue reading...

items.title: Aston Villa lodge complaint after bottle thrown at their bench at end of Chelsea win
items.summary: Chelsea intend to cooperate with the investigation Emery plays down title talk after 11th consecutive win Aston Villa lodged a complaint to Chelsea after a bottle of water was thrown at their bench at the end of their 2-1 victory at Stamford Bridge. There were jubilant scenes at full time after a stunning comeback moved Villa three points off Arsenal at the top of the Premier League. However, the celebrations also featured the away dugout being showered with water when the final whistle was blown. It was not clear if the bottle was thrown by someone from the Chelsea bench or whether it came from the crowd. Chelsea intend to cooperate with the investigation. Continue reading...
